question: Which of the following events brought Gandhi to the mainstream of Indian struggle for independence, ushering Gandhian Era in Indian politics?
explanation: Jinnah had resigned from the Council in protest against the Rowlatt Acts, 1919. Gandhi launched a nationwide protest against what came to be clubbed as the “Black Acts”. In fact, it were the Rowlatt Acts that marked the emergence of Mahatma Gandhi on the national scene. On 6 April 1919, a nation-wide ‘hartal’ was organised, and fasts were offered to oppose the laws—the event came to be known as the ‘Rowlatt Satyagraha’. It was also launch of Non-cooperation Movement.
